threads.com:
Look, I'm not saying that he's wrong about >everything<, but he is certainly wrong about the Martians.
If Martians lacked all emotions and were "pure logical beings" (his own words) then why on mars would they become warmongers?
War is largely an emotion driven activity and total planetary destruction is an extremely illogical course of action. Beings of pure logic would not get so upset that they would destroy their own planet.
Also, the rest of the story has the Martians being "pissed" and "angry" and "ecstatic" (his own words) over various things. Being angry and ecstatic are emotions. And if they were beings of pure logic, why would they just let a comet hit the earth? It's completely illogical to cave into emotional Atlantean demands when they knew that the comet would hurt the Martians.
If anyone was the being of pure logic, it must have been the manipulative Atlanteans who tricked the Martians into committing suicide. The Martians are passionate and naive in this story.

Pic related. Look how angry they are. Why are they so angry if they are beings of pure logic? What has them so upset? Why are they pissed off?
In almost every depiction of Martians, they are either laughing like maniacs or throbbing mad. Compare this with how the Atlanteans are depicted: calm and collected most of the time. And they manipulated the Martians into committing national suicide.

Ah yes the classic "I'm too stupid to read above a 2nd grade level" defense.

Since you're still here I'll drop more links then. Here is a paper from 2019 describing one of the many uses for "smart dust". The internet -> human mind interface.

https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fnins.2019.00112/full

The Internet comprises a decentralized global system that serves humanity’s collective effort to generate, process, and store data, most of which is handled by the rapidly expanding cloud. A stable, secure, real-time system may allow for interfacing the cloud with the human brain. One promising strategy for enabling such a system, denoted here as a “human brain/cloud interface” (“B/CI”), would be based on technologies referred to here as “neuralnanorobotics.” Future neuralnanorobotics technologies are anticipated to facilitate accurate diagnoses and eventual cures for the ∼400 conditions that affect the human brain. Neuralnanorobotics may also enable a B/CI with controlled connectivity between neural activity and external data storage and processing, via the direct monitoring of the brain’s ∼86 × 109 neurons and ∼2 × 1014 synapses. Subsequent to navigating the human vasculature, three species of neuralnanorobots (endoneurobots, gliabots, and synaptobots) could traverse the blood–brain barrier (BBB), enter the brain parenchyma, ingress into individual human brain cells, and autoposition themselves at the axon initial segments of neurons (endoneurobots), within glial cells (gliabots), and in intimate proximity to synapses (synaptobots). They would then wirelessly transmit up to ∼6 × 1016 bits per second of synaptically processed and encoded human–brain electrical information via auxiliary nanorobotic fiber optics (30 cm3) with the capacity to handle up to 1018 bits/sec and provide rapid data transfer to a cloud based supercomputer for real-time brain-state monitoring and data extraction.

>The kajanok is a cryptid arthropod reported from shallow bays and lakes in Greenland and the Canadian Arctic, generally described as a giant aquatic arachnid. -don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

threads.com:
The modern term Gnosis originates from the Greek "γνῶσις (gnōsis)" meaning "knowledge", and is defined in the Merriam-Webster dictionary as "esoteric knowledge of spiritual truth". While it's commonly associated to the mystic philosophy of Gnosticism (along with Chaos Magick), it can be related towards any significant experience or state of intrinsic knowing regardless of one's spiritual path.

Metanoia is referred to as a "spiritual transformation and change of heart", originating from the Greek "μετάνοια (metanoia) meaning "changing one's mind". Saint Paul the Apostle's mystical experience on the road to Damascus is a notable example of this occurring suddenly.

Who here has achieved Gnosis or undergone Metanoia? If reached, how did you get there? Meditation and contemplation? Being present in the "now"? Something instantaneous without much effort?

>There is the possible concern of media bias in a reader becoming too attached to their own imagined and romanticized version of your story.
Quite. It's not like my example can be followed. But belief's a sticky bugger and allowing others to trick themselves into looking for signs feels counterproductive.
Dismantling what makes up one's ego will differ, which is why I prefer to stay vague.
That said, it was a long while until I had a name for what had happened. Same with any occult knowledge really, reading it and living it are wildly different.

Stepping away from the vague descriptions, I actively started seeking knowledge and letting go of my beliefs at about 15. A lot of trauma was involved, several years of struggling with depression. I had to put a lid on anything occult for a while because the sheer nastiness I was attracting had brought me to my knees, and then the derealization started. Slowly at first, but after I got help for my depression and managed to get rid of it, the derealization only got more intense. I'd spend whole days dissociating and it made me want to hide away, because not feeling present with people or place felt wrong. That left a lot of time to get back into the occult, grasping at anything that felt real when nothing else did. And I guess that did it.
Took a few more years to rearrange a semblance of a functioning person, and it can be hard to reconcile sometimes how there's still trauma that affects me, or how my ego's still able to dig its heels in at times. But it will never be the same, and there's no conceivable version of reality where it would make sense for it to be.

I'm curious about your experience if you're not opposed to sharing.

King Josiah went through heavy reforms on the current day Old Testament/Torah/Whatever to render it more monotheistic (this is where the larp of a Monotheistic faith comes with most Jews, Muslims, and Christians, no historical basis for it at all) from a polytheistic/henotheistic religious tradition in the Temple beforehand.

>https://byustudies.byu.edu/article/joseph-smith-and-preexilic-israelite-religion/

threads.com:
A few weeks ago and I was watching the newly released blameitonjorge video, “The lost media of creepypastas”. One of the segments was about the backrooms, and I was excited that somebody was finally gonna explore the origin of the concept, unfortunately though, his focus was on the actual image attached to the most famous backrooms post. Regarding the backrooms themselves, he referred to the 2 threads made in 2019 and said they were the origin point. Which got me thinking, has anybody actually looked deeper into where this idea originates from? I scoured the internet, but the popularity of the backrooms makes finding anything meaningful difficult, and almost everybody refers to those 2 posts as the point where it all began.
But before we get carried away, let’s define what it is we’re looking for. ‘The backrooms’ does not cut it, as we’re not looking for this specific creepypasta, but the origin of the concept itself. And here is how I define the concept:
>A glitch in reality that causes you to end up in an empty world of never-ending liminal spaces.
This idea certainly goes back further than 2019, but so far, I’ve been unable to find any theories/creepypastas which clearly outline it. There’s stuff like Michigan Blue Hell, and liminal spaces themselves have been a thing for a while now, but the combination of glitching out of reality and an empty world of liminal spaces seems nowhere to be found. And yet, I and a number of others online seemingly have memories of a concept that at least somewhat fits this definition going back many years back, and I find it hard to believe that this idea wasn’t expressed somewhere before 2019.

So, what do you think /x/, have any of you looked into the origins of this? Or do you have your own experiences of a backrooms-like concept that pre-date the 2019 posts? The concept just has to go back further than that, but I’m running out of places to look.

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.sub: Share stories of your first interactions with the shadow people.
threads.com:
I shall start, at the age of 9 years old I was diagnosed with asthma, it wasn't too severe but part of the reason I was diagnosed was because I kept waking up in the middle of the night gasping for breath and my lungs weren't able to draw in any air. One of these nights I had a very intense nightmare, the details are foggy all these years later, but after waking from the nightmare I found myself staring at the ceiling of a pitch black room not being able to draw in air again. I run to my parents room to wake them up and get help but the second I touch the doorknob I am able to breathe again, I still wake up my parents and tell them what happened and they suggest for me to sleep in their room tonight. So I slept on the floor beside them and directly past my feet was an opening in the wall that leads to the master bathroom. There is no door at this opening and I was just staring into the black nothingness of the bathroom. As I am staring I begin to see a pair of hands appear from the left side of the wall and start wrapping its fingers around the wall. As I continue to stare at it the face appeared and the upper body of it. Its body was more black than the darkness of the empty bathroom and its eyes were glowing blood red, it stared directly at me for about 5 seconds than slowly disappeared from where it came. It can be guessed that I did not sleep for the rest of the night and I have never told either of my parents about this interaction with the shadow people I had.

So share your stories anons, have you ever seen the shadow people?

>>33502378
I worked as a highway patrol officer briefly, and it's on duty that I had 90% of my shadow people encounters. Always late at night of course, I used to dismiss them as hallucinations until an encounter I had in 2015. I pulled my car off to the side of a desolate slice of road because I needed to take a piss. It was real late, and it was around winter time and it was real cold out. I left my car's headlights on as I was watering the flowers, and I heard something scrap across the asphalt real softly behind me. I spun my head around, and for just a few seconds I saw something begin to take a step further into the headlights before quickly sliding back into the darkness. My heart skipped a few beats as I realized what the fuck I just saw, and I quickly zipped up my fly and got back into my car, probably breaking the speed limit as I got the fuck out of there.

A few months later, now in 2016, I had my second encounter. It was just a few hours before I got off duty, so I was taking it slow and relaxing with some KISS blasting on the car's stereo. Again it was real late, and I noticed I was low on gas. I stopped at a little pit stop gas station and began filling up my tank, and I saw someone standing on the other side of the road. Now there weren't many street lamps out in these parts, it was far too rural for the state to bother spending money for lights, but from the edge of the light from the gas station, I swear I could vaguely make out the shape of a man wearing a hat slowly encroaching on the edge of the light. It wasn't until a car drove past that the shape vanished.

last_replies.com:
(Pt. 1)
I was well into adulthood and had moved into my old childhood home when I had my encounters. The first time it was just a shadowy man walking past the open living room door down the hallway, but since I lived alone it was enough to scare the shit out of me. The second time it walked around in the bathroom opposite the living room, and appeared much blacker this time under the yellow bathroom light. Like with most of my encounters it was during daytime and I was completely lucid.
I should mention that there had been a very dramatic episode in the house when I was younger culminating in a suicide, and that following it I had heard angry whispers, hisses, things moving, and even a scream from the location of the suicide. My sister often complained of people in her bedroom pestering her at night. This bedroom had since been turned into a living room by the time I moved in, the same living room where I had most of my encounters.
It was what followed my first encounters that fucked me up. The more I experienced the more anxious and sleepless I got. I could see them moving around even if only 5% of their silhouette was visible. I saw one staring at me in the reflection of a cupboard glass door.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>33505343
(Pt. 2)
One time I saw a black shadowy creature manifesting directly in front of my eyes, forming itself on my carpet into the size of a cat but with multiple legs like a spider or a crab. It slowly made its way towards me and I was compelled to just watch on as it did, incapable of doing anything. As it crossed the threshold into my living room I could see its body disappearing as if crawling under an invisible table (I believe the different light in the room caused this). My eyes continued to trail along until I knew it would have to be right beside me. Then I saw a shadowy limb reach out and touch the side of my head, which left me light headed and so spooked I had to get out of the house. While at my wits end lying in bed the following night I had the bedside table shake like there was an earthquake under it. Every time I was about to fall asleep I had hypnagogic hallucinations of people talking and shouting. Finally, a horrible female scream blasted into my right ear which put me in a paralyzed panic and overwhelmed me with unbearable tingling all over my head. That was fortunately the last of it and even if I was a wreck the rest of the year, it all more or less stopped after that.
